vectorData.altText: 9. Regarding the functional subdivisions of the cerebellum, the cerebellar hemispheres comprise the ____________________.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
Thatâ€™s right!  The cerebrocerebellum is comprised of the lateral cerebellar hemispheres.

In the anatomy lab, you identified key anatomical features of the superior (A) and inferior (B) surfaces of the cerebellum. 
In this figure, these features are co-related with the three functional subdivisions of the cerebellum.
The vestibulocerebellum is comprised of the flocculus and nodule. 
The spinocerebellum is comprised of the vermis and paravermal regions.
The cerebrocerebellum is comprised of the lateral cerebellar hemispheres.
In addition, you identified the three pairs of cerebellar peduncles:
the superior cerebellar peduncles associated with the midbrain
the middle cerebellar peduncles, associated with the pons
the inferior cerebellar peduncles, associated with the medulla
